sen.j: 兵粮奉行（ひょうろうぶぎょう）または小荷駄奉行（こにだぶぎょう）は、日本の戦国時代_(日本)において行軍・戦闘中の兵糧輸送（小荷駄）を担当する奉行のこと。
sen.e: Hyoro bugyo or Konida bugyo refers to a bugyo (magistrate) in charge of transportation of provisions (konida) during march and battle in the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) in Japan.

Hyoro Bugyo or Konida Bugyo refers to a bugyo (magistrate) who was in charge of the transportation of provisions (konida) during marches and battles during the Sengoku Period (Period of Warring States) in Japan.
sen.cmt: capitalized "Bugyo" for consistency with the title; fixed grammar
sen.e: Hyoro Bugyo or Konida Bugyo refers to a bugyo (magistrate) who was in charge of the transportation of provisions (konida) during marches and battles during the Sengoku period (period of Warring States) in Japan.
sen.cmt: Periodの頭文字を小文字に変更

sen.j: 戦争時においてのみ置かれ、平時に置かれる事はなかった。
sen.e: It was appointed only during wartime, not in peacetime.
The position was appointed only during wartime and did not exist during peacetime.
sen.cmt: changed "It" to "The position"; fixed grammar
sen.e: The position was appointed only during wartime and did not exist during peacetime.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 小荷駄を前進させることを目的としたため、小荷駄押（こにだおし）などとも呼ばれた。
sen.e: It was also called Konidaoshi (konida pusher) because it was to carry konida forward.
It was also called Konida-oshi (literally "konida pusher") as its purpose was to carry konida forward.
sen.cmt: added "literally" and hyphen in "Konida-oshi" to give the words more definition; fixed grammar
sen.e: It was also called Konida-oshi (literally "konida pusher") as its purpose was to carry konida forward.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 戦時には基本的に個々の兵士が兵糧を携帯するのが慣わしであったが、実際には大量の兵糧携帯が行軍の邪魔になることから数日分の持参が限界であった。
sen.e: Although it was customary that each soldier basically carried provisions, carrying the amount for a few days was actually all they could do because carrying a big amount of provisions hindered the march.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: Although it was a standard custom for each soldier to carry their own provisions, they were limited to carrying enough for only a few days since it was not practical to hinder the march by having them carry large loads.
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence and fixed grammar to read more understandably and naturally
sen.e: Although it was a standard custom for each soldier to carry their own provisions, they were limited to carrying enough for only a few days since it was not practical to hinder the march by having them carry large loads.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: それ以上の期間にわたる戦闘の際には兵粮奉行が小荷駄隊を率いて領内から兵糧を輸送を行う事になっていた。
sen.e: When the battle lasted more than that, Hyoro bugyo was supposed to transport the provisions from the territory leading Konidatai (caravan of men and animals carrying supplies).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: During longer battles, a Hyoro Bugyo was in charge of leading a Konidatai (caravan of men and animals carrying supplies) to transport provisions from the domain.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to read more smoothly
sen.e: During longer battles, a Hyoro Bugyo was in charge of leading a Konidatai (caravan of men and animals carrying supplies) to transport provisions from the domain.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: また、必要に応じて米や大豆などの買い付けなどの兵糧確保を行うのも重要な仕事であった。
sen.e: And it was also his important work to secure provisions by buying rice and soybeans as necessary.
They were also given the important task of securing provisions by buying rice and soybeans when necessary.
sen.cmt: eliminated "And" at the beginning of the sentence; fixed grammar
sen.e: They were also given the important task of securing provisions by buying rice and soybeans when necessary.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: これらは本来御蔵奉行などの役目であったが、臨機応変に対応するために兵糧を扱う実務者がこれを行うようになったものである。
sen.e: These were originally roles of Okura bugyo (the magistrate of storehouse), but the actual person handling provisions started to work on them in order to adapt to circumstances.

Although these duties were originally given to the Okura Bugyo (the magistrate of a storehouse), the person who actually handled the provisions began to perform the work in order to adapt to circumstances.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar
sen.e: Although these duties were originally given to the Okura Bugyo (the magistrate of a storehouse), the person who actually handled the provisions began to perform the work in order to adapt to circumstances.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 優れた馬などは最前線にて用いられたために、小荷駄隊は足軽及び農村から徴発された人夫（陣夫）が駄馬や荷車に兵糧などを載せて引率するという機動性・戦闘力いずれも劣る部隊である。
sen.e: Since swift horses were used on the frontlines, Konidatai, that ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and laborers (servicemen) levied from farming villages led daba (packhorses) and carts with provisions on, was a troop with inferior mobility and fighting capability.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: Since swift horses were used on the front lines, a Konidatai was a troop with inferior mobility and fighting capability that carried provisions on daba (packhorses) and carts levied from farming villages by ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and laborers (servicemen).
sen.cmt: rearranged sentence to read more understandably
sen.e: Since swift horses were used on the front lines, a Konidatai was a troop with inferior mobility and fighting capability that carried provisions on daba (packhorses) and carts by ashigaru (common foot soldiers) and laborers (servicemen) levied from farming villages.
sen.cmt: 「農村から徴発された人夫」となるよう、"levied from farming villages"の位置を移動

sen.j: なおかつ軍の後方に位置しながらも敵軍に襲われる可能性が高い部隊であった。
sen.e: Furthermore, it was a troop which was highly likely attacked by the enemy army, although it was located posterior in the army.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の原則の例外対処
sen.e: Even though a Konidatai troop was positioned at the rear of the army, there was a high possibility that it would be attacked by the enemy.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: Even though a Konidatai troop was positioned at the rear of the army, there was a high possibility that it would be attacked by the enemy.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 長距離の遠征になればなるほど、小荷駄隊の重要性が増加する一方、その襲撃を受ける可能性とその損失による軍隊への打撃は大きくなった。
sen.e: The further they went away, the more Konidatai gained importance, and on the other hand, the bigger the possibility of being attacked and the damage to the army due to its loss became.
The further the distance travelled in a campaign, the more important a Konidatai troop became, while also increasing the possibility of being attacked and the damage done to the army due to its loss.
sen.cmt: fixed to read more naturally
sen.e: The further the distance travelled in a campaign, the more important a Konidatai troop became, while also increasing the possibility of being attacked and the damage done to the army due to its loss.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: そのため、戦国大名家の職制では、武者奉行と同格の戦闘経験が豊富な熟練の老臣が任じられるケースが多く、直接戦闘に参加して武功を上げるよりも輸送する小荷駄を敵軍から防衛する事が求められた。
sen.e: Therefore, an accomplished roshin (old or key retainer) with a lot of combat experiences ranking with musha bugyo (magistrate of warriors) was often appointed in the organization of families of Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period), he was required to protect the konida to transport from the enemy army, rather than to join the battle directly to distinguish himself.

As a preventative measure, an accomplished roshin (key retainer) with a wealth of combat experience in rank with Musha bugyo (magistrate of warriors), who was often appointed in the organization of a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) family, was given the task of protecting the transport of Konida from enemy armies rather than directly joining the battle in order to distinguish himself.
sen.cmt: added "As a preventative measure" for better clarity; fixed grammar to read more naturally
sen.e: As a preventative measure, an accomplished roshin (key retainer) with a wealth of combat experience in rank with Musha bugyo (magistrate of warriors), who was often appointed in the organization of a Sengoku daimyo (Japanese territorial lords in the Sengoku period) family, was given the task of protecting the transport of Konida from enemy armies rather than directly joining the battle in order to distinguish himself.
sen.cmt: 修正なし
